in the first century after Christ the
Society of the Mediterranean world
consisted of 5 well-defined strata 1 the
aristocracy the upper classes with money
and official power the privileged and
ruling groups - the business groups the
merchants princes and the bankers the
traders the big importers and exporters
the international merchants 3 the small
middle-class although this group was

provided the moral backbone of the early

groups to continue in their various
crafts and trains
among the Jews many of the Pharisees
belong to this class of tradesmen for
the free proletariat this group had
little or no social standing though
proud of their freedom they were placed
in great disadvantage because they were
forced to compete with slave labor the
upper classes regarded them disdainfully
allowing that they were useless except
for breeding purposes five the slaves
half the population of the Roman state
were slaves many were superior
individuals and quickly made their way
up among the free proletariat and even
among the tradesmen the majority were

even of superior peoples was a feature

unqualified the early Christian Church
was largely composed of the lower
classes and these slaves superior slaves
often received wages and by saving their

many such emancipated slaves rose to

modified form of slavery there was no

the major portion of the populace

there was always the open door through

these schools of philosophy were the

the better Epicureans were not given to

the better classes
the Stoics believed that a controlling
reasoned fate dominated all nature they
taught that the soul of man was divine
that it was imprisoned in the evil body
of physical nature man's soul achieved
Liberty by living in harmony with nature
with God

vente Melchisedec

never became widespread these

this pseudoscience of Babylon developed

the close of the first century before
Christ the religious thought of

though the Hellenized Jewish beliefs

the Hellenized Jews brought to the

quite a different story of the master's
life he began to follow Paul and learn
of the story in teaching of Jesus in AD
47 Luke preserves much of the grace of

he gathered up these facts from Paul and
others Luke presents the master as the
friend of publicans and sinners he did
not formulate his many notes into the
gospel until after Paul's death Luke
wrote in the year 82 in a care he
planned three books dealing with the
history of Christ and Christianity but
died in 1890 just before he finished the
second of these works the Acts of the
Apostles as material for the compilation
of his gospel Luke first dependent upon

related it to him Luke's Gospel is
therefore in some ways the Gospel
according to Paul but Luke had other

he not only interviewed scores of

also had with him a copy of Mark's

Isadora's narrative and a brief record

believer
named seeds Luke also had a mutilated
and much edited copy of some notes
purported to have been made by the
Apostle Andrew for the Gospel of John
the Gospel according to John relates
much of Jesus's work in Judea and around
Jerusalem which is not contained in the
other records this is a so-called Gospel
according to John the son of Zebedee and
though John did not write it he did
inspire it since its first writing and
the several times been edited to made
appear to have been written by John
himself when this record was made John
had the other Gospels and he saw that
much had been omitted accordingly in the
year ad 101 he encouraged his associates
Nathan a Greek Jew from Caesarea to
begin the writing John supplied his
material from memory and by reference to
the three records already in existence
he had no written records of his own the
Epistle known as first John was written
by John himself as a covering letter for
the work which Nathan executed under his
direction all these writers presented
honest pictures of Jesus as they saw
remembered or had learned of him and as
their concepts of these distant events
were affected by their subsequent
espousal of Paul's theology of
Christianity and these records imperfect
as they are have been sufficient to
change the course of history of urantia
for almost 2,000 years
acknowledgment in carrying out my
commission to restate the teaching and
retell the doings of Jesus of Nazareth I
have drawn free upon all sources of
record and Planetary information my
ruling motive has been to prepare a
record which will not only be
enlightening to the generation of men
now living but which may also be helpful
to all future generations from the vast
store of information available to me I
have chosen that which is best suited to
the accomplishment of this purpose as
far as possible I have derived my
information from purely human sources
only when such sources failed have I
resorted to those records which are
superhuman when ideas and concepts of
Jesus's life and teachings have been
acceptable expressed by a human mind I
invariably gave preference to such
apparently human thought pattern
although I have sought to adjust the
verbal expression the better to conform
to our concept of the real meaning and
the to import of the Masters life and
teaching as far as possible
I have adhere to the actual human
concept and thought pattern in all my
narrative I well know that these
concepts which have had origin in the
human mind will prove more acceptable
and helpful to all of the human minds
when able to find the necessary concept
in the human records or in the human
expression I have next resorted to the
memory resources of my own order of
earth creatures the midwayers
and when that secondary source of
information proved inadequate
I have unhesitating resorted to the
super planetary sources of information
the memoranda which I have collected and
from which I have prepared this
narrative of the life and teachings of
Jesus aside from the memory of the
record of the Apostle Andrew embrace
thought gems and superior concepts of
Jesus's teaching assembled from more
than 2,000 human beings who have lived
on earth from the days of Jesus down to
the time of the indicted of these
revelations more correctly restatement
the revelatory permissions have been
utilized only when the human record and
human concepts failed a supply and
adequate thought pattern my revelatory
Commission forbade me to resort to extra
human sources of either information or
expression until such a time as I could
testify that I had failed in my efforts
to find the required conceptual
expression in purely human sources while
I with the collaboration of my eleven
associate fellow midwayers and under the
supervision of the Melchizedek of record
have portrayed this narrative and
accordance with my concept of its
effective arrangement and in response to
my choice of immediate expression
nevertheless the majority of the ideas
and even some of the effective
expressions which I have thus utilized
had their origin in the minds of the men
of many races who have lived on earth
during the intervening generations right
on down to those who are still alive at
the time of this undertaking in many
ways I have served more as a collector
and editor than as an original narrator
I have unhesitatingly appropriated these
ideas and concepts
preferably human which would named me to

to restate his matchless teachings in
the most striking helpful and
universally uplifting phraseology
in behalf of the Brotherhood of the
